title: What is your favorite BTS song? - Quora

response.answer_text: My top 10 favourite BTS songs are, in no particular order: 2!3!: This gives me chills every goddamn time I listen to it, I especially love it when they perform this song because when Armys take over, I get goosebumps. The bond Armys and BTS have with each other is invaluable and the raw emotion behind their voices (especially rap line) make me really emotional too, and every time I hear the song I either almost cry or actually cry. Plus, the lyrics are so inspirational and reassuring… they're here for us and they’re showing that we’re here for them by being open and honest about their own emotions and life journey.Young Forever: The thing about this song is that while it’s called Young Forever, it never talks about how amazing youth is and how it feels to be young. It’s more about loving the way they are now and never wanting to change (main example in this is J-Hope’s line: “Even if the attention isn’t forever, I’ll keep singing/As today’s me, I want eternity/Forever, I want to be young” - not gonna lie, my favourite part and lyric) which I think is such a beautiful thing. They’re scared of the future and also have bad moments (like Suga’s bit tells us) but all in all, life is beautiful. The lyrics are so gorgeous and it accurately shows what some people feel: you don’t want things to change for fear of the future but also because you like it the way you are now, but that doesn’t mean life isn’t amazing - there are still bad moments we all have to deal with.N.O: This is my first title track on this list because I absolutely adore this song. Listen, the lyrics are so freeing and inspirational, especially because it came from a place where they weren’t doing so well either. Despite all their hardships, they told us to stop listening to others and do what we want to do because even if they’re struggling, they still loved what they did and wouldn’t change it for the world. For most of us Asians (and other ethnicities too), it seems a lot like us vs our parents. Do we listen to them like society pressures us to do, or do we do what we want to do and make our own path even if it means personal sacrifices? I really identified with this song because it’s true - we can’t keep listening to them as they try to push back our dreams by saying “later” all the time. One of my favourite BTS title tracks of all time.I’m Fine: This is one song that I wish we got more performances of even if we already have quite a few. I love everything about this song: from the lyrics to the choreography to the aesthetic. I absolutely love their performances of this because the choreography is gorgeous: the entrance where Taehyung lies down on top of his members seem very symbolic to me even if it isn’t supposed to have a meaning (I interpreted it as the members being each other’s support) and I really loved how original it was (also, it gave me a little bit of I Need U vibes where Taehyung’s the one being sat on by Hoseok). The lyrics are so positive and happy because it’s about moving on from the dark times of your life to happier times - they reflect on the people who helped them and says that I think I’m fine, I’ll let go of your hand now. It’s important to accept help and realise that you can’t do it alone and I loved that because it’s something I need to remind myself sometimes and it gives a lot of credit to the people who help you behind the scenes. While independence is definitely very important, co-dependence is too. (Plus Suga’s rap verse is absolutely lit)Answer: Love Myself: I’m not gonna lie, one of the main reasons I picked this song was because of Suga’s entire verse (I don’t want to take up more space than necessary so here’s a small teaser of the original lyrics: 어쩌면 누군가를 사랑하는 것보다더 어려운 게 나 자신을 사랑하는 거야솔직히 인정할 건 인정하자니가 내린 잣대들은 너에게 더 엄격하단 걸). This song overall is an amazing song: I love the energy, the lyrics are amazing from start to finish. I could copy and paste any lyric from the song and it would be a form of art, really. It makes me feel much better about myself and I guess it’s a very nostalgic song for me, it makes me thing about my own past and pick up on my own flaws while also giving me a reprieve from self-loathing.Tomorrow: I love this song the same way I love Answer: Love Myself. Obviously they’re two completely different songs and they sound different and have completely different lyrics, but I love the energy we get when they sing this song on the album and when they perform it. For the rest of us that aren’t celebrities or entertainers or whatever, we probably feel what they sing: life is repetitive, the same work, the same everything and most of us probably aren’t ever going to be rich no matter how hard you work and will always be working or middle class, the repetitiveness is probably never going to end and it makes things… boring. Tomorrow isn’t a “new” day, it feels more like today but just repeated. But this song accurately represents the mindset of probably the majority - and the more we can hope for, really, is that someday something will break and change and be a little more exciting, a little more positive.Pied Piper: I love this song for the obvious reasons. The cheekiness of the lyrics just puts a smile on my face: it’s humorous because they’re being so cocky by almost making fun of the “stan” mindset but they’re not really making fun of their fans. It isn’t about “Go get a life you losers” or “My pockets are filled with cash that I spend on partying” like you’d expect when you hear the word cocky in regards to lyrics, but in a different way. The lyrics seem more like they’re worried for us and it’s such a fun little song. The song itself is hypnotising and the vocals are goddamn beautiful. I know it’s deliberate but it genuinely seems to put me under a spell, like the Pied Piper. And also because it’s a very obvious tale, not too deep for me to have to try and prise open to understand.House of Cards: This is a song that I just love and not for any particular reason, I just love the haunting and mysterious beauty of their voices. I’ve never experienced love like they’re describing so it’s a little difficult for me to relate to it, but I love the hypnotic breathiness of it and the beautiful idea of something so shaky and about to tip over: I’m almost on edge the whole way throughout the song. Also, the whispery last line is so emotional and such a memorable way to end the song for me, it really makes an impact.Ddaeng: One of my absolute favourite rap line songs, I thought it was so good because it also had like an easy inspiration. I remember singing the original song as a child and it was such a shock and really creative for them to put a spin on it the way they did. I loved the points of the song, how it almost seemed repetitive but had a different meaning each time. The wordplay was really fun and I was really surprised how direct they were being to be honest, they hadn’t been that direct about their criticisms for a while.Spring Day: No list would be complete without the queen, Spring Day. This song, I am not gonna lie, did not make me cry but it’s because I thought that despite the very emotional and quite dark lyrics, it seemed a very hopeful song to me. It wasn’t completely miserable but it reminded me of that quote that says “Light at the end of the tunnel” but it almost seemed like the lyrics were describing someone who was almost at the end of the tunnel and the light was reachable. After N.O, this has got to be my favourite title track. The performance aspect of it was absolutely beautiful as well, the choreography is complicated so it reminds a very “BTS” song but it’s also very peaceful so it matches the tone of the song (also, a small sidenote but I thought their outfits were also very calm and soft that it matched the whole aura of the song completely). I liked how by the end of the song, the lyrics subtly change and the image of the snowflakes and flowers made it very realistic to me, it drew a picture in my head every time I listened to it.

I like quite a few: Not in any order because I can't really rank them. Idol: This one gets its own section. I actually love Idol. It was actually the song that convinced me to stan BTS. Because I had heard their music before but I'm really picky and hard to impress. And older so I guess not everything appeals to me like before. A lot of people don't like it. And I personally judge them… Just kidding. I think what sold me was the performance. I think I saw the Tonight Show one and my first thought was ‘pftt Kpop, been there done that. Don't these groups today have anything new--Is that? Are they doing African dance?!’ Then I looked up the music video and the lyrics and was even more sold with the symbolism and the wordplay. A few hours and music videos later and I was a full fledged ARMY. First Love by Suga: This song is probably secretly my bias wrecker if my favorite song was a bias. I have been listening to rap since I was a child and I have never been more impressed with an idol rapper until Suga. Also I tend to be pretty cold when it comes to emotional songs and this one made me cry so… Sea: Where there is hope there is despair…I don't really have words for how much I love this song so here's a heart ♡ House of Cards: I get kind of annoyed seeing comments on how sexy the song is sometimes because that is all fans seem to comment on aside from the pretty awesome lyrics and genius composition and beautiful harmony. It's also not about what many fans think it is. There's nothing risque in those lyrics. Attack on Bangtan: It's like an anthem of fire and the best rookie level song to have on my playlist as I wash dishes. I Need U: I never get tired of this song Run: I also never get tired of this song 4′O Clock: Taehyung’s voice is so gorgeous and soothing and this song is the best song to listen to on the bus Ddaeng by the Rapline: The wordplay. I love it. Cypher 2 and 3 by the Rapline and Supreme Boi: Is fire. But seriously the wordplay. I'm in love. Adult Child by Suga and Jin: Extremely relatable War of Hormones: I admire how BTS were like we are idols and we like women here's a song about it. And I like how it's the most respectful song of its kind. Like a polite Baby Got Back. Mikrokosmos: This song is magic live. The Truth Untold: Friggin gorgeous song. The lyrics. The singing. The fact that it got my brother who is a textbook hipster who doesn't even like Kpop and is never impressed by any mainstream artists to go “Wow”. Whalien52: It's a song about a lonely whale. And it's based on an actual species of whale and it's so sad and I just love it so much Singularity: Anytime Taehyung sings I am happy, but this is my favorite solo. Awake: Gives me hope. Lie: I find myself listening to this one a lot. Jimin's voice is really underrated here. Serendipity: Sounds even better live. Just One Day: For some reason my playlist always defaults to this song. And I'm okay with it. Bapsae: This probably my favorite social issues song Dope: I may or may not have this song on constant repeat Fake Love: At first I didn't like it. Now I don't know how many times I've played it. Spring Day: Is perfect. Danger: I don't know what it is but it's probably my most replayed song.

response.answer_text: I have a few that I like. While BTS isn’t my favorite group, I’ve always liked their music, and so I’m pretty familiar with all of them. The catchy tunes and the strong beats just get stuck inside your head before you know it. I think one of the reasons why they have such a huge fanbase is because they have genuinely good music. And unlike American pop (that’s literally dying right now and is being overtaken by rap/hip-hop) they often have more variety to their melodies and beats. I’ll leave that for now - I can save that part for another answer. And um, this my opinion, so make sure you don’t get offended. Save MEfrom The Most Beautiful Moment in Life: Young Forever - 2016 I think this has been my favorite song (at least by them) for a long time. No matter how many times I listen to it, I never get bored. At first, I just liked the sound of it - upbeat, amped, and danceable. Honestly, it sounded like any pop/k-pop song out there. However, when I read the lyrics, that was simply not the case… I’d say the lyrics were darker than expected, not to mention depressing. But you know what? It resonated with me because that was when my PTSD/depression was starting to bloom. And the fact that I had something that I could connect with really moved me, and I liked the song even more. 2. Run from The Most Beautiful Moment in Life, Part 2 - 2015 Again, depressing lyrics. But I liked the painful meaning behind it - it added more depth and meaning to the song. The song itself really gave off their vibes. The pace was slower than Save ME, and there was a wider range of notes. And boy was it intense. Overall, I think it was a very well-structured song with clever integration of rap. 3. Butterfly from The Most Beautiful Moment in Life, Part 2 - 2015 This song used to make me almost cry. The tone felt bittersweet, which adds a whole new layer of sentimentality. It’s a beautiful song (that deserved a music video). I found it really similar to Run though. It really depends on your taste which one you like better. 4. BTS Cypher PT.3:KILLER from Dark & Wild - 2014 This is my favorite cypher, as well as my 4th favorite BTS song. It’s just fire. You can just tell by the first second. While the whole Dark & Wild album itself was pure gold (an incredible fusion of different genres), I just couldn’t get over this song. THEY HAVE SKILLS. That’s all I have to say. Rap line+Supreme Boi, well done. 5. House Of Cards from The Most Beautiful Moment in Life, Part 2 - 2015 (full version: The Most Beautiful Moment in Life: Young Forever - 2016) Easily the best outro. The strings in the background create a dramatic mood and the vocals really stand out as opposed to a more instrumental based song like Blood Sweat & Tears. Each part really suited the members, although Jin and V should’ve gotten more lines. If you’re into fanfiction, House Of Cards is a great one. Check it out. Some songs that need to be mentioned: Rain - from Dark & Wild - 2014 Epiphany - from Love Yourself: Answer - 2018 Lie - from Wings - 2016 Serendipity - from Love Yourself: Her - 2017 (full version: Love Yourself: Answer - 2018) Interlude: Wings - from Wings - 2016 The Last - from/by Agust-D - 2016 Of course, this is my personal list, and I only wrote those that were my real favorites. Some of these songs are really underrated, so I hope people will take notice of these amazing songs.

I can't say that I have a one and only favorite that I place on a pedestal higher than everything else, so I'm going to name a few. I Need U (The Most Beautiful Moment in Life: Young Forever) This one really turned my head when I first heard it and I have never stopped loving it since. I feel like the sadness and melencoly vibes of a breakup are so well captured in this beautiful track. If you listen closely to the tech-drop, you can hear faint breathing, or panting in the back, and this just reminds me of how it's so hard to breath and find peace with yourself when you've lost the one you love and ultimately, need. A lot of times people overlook I Need U and call it overrated, but I can tell you there has never been a song that has exceeded this one since the album was released.Dimple/Illegal (Love Yourself Her) The lyrics are along the lines of "These dimples are illegal, so I'll call you Illegirl". Like, oh my gosh whoever came up with that is a complete genius! I love Dimple/Illegal for it's insanely clever use of lyrics and also for the way it describes being in love and not being able to handle when he/she smiles and laughs. I feel this way all the time when my crush smiles and I honestly wish I could tell him to stop and that it kills me every time. A lot of people feel this way when the person they love is laughing or smiling, and it's just this overwhelming joy that is inside you that the boys sing about in this track.Converse High (The Most Beautiful Moment in Life: Young Forever) As far as this song goes, it's mainly about how the guy is in love with the girl and how she always wears her Converse sneakers. Me, as a high school girl, I also really love Converse and I also love it when the guy I like wears his too. I just really think that this song can be related to by so many people, because it's so true that when he/she wears a certain thing, it makes you fall for them that much more. I also love the fact that when the boys sing this song, it takes me back to when they were little and just starting out. It gives me the ultimate 2014 Bangtan Boys vibes.Fake Love (Love Yourself Tear) This is the brand new one everyone is talking about. I am especially in love with the rock mix, and it’s seriously amazing. I think for me, the boys really showcase their maturity and growth in this track, and I am so proud of them and how far they’ve come. Fake Love also really reflects on how devastating it is to realize that the relationship you are in is all a lie. They really show how lost you can feel and how unsteady you are after being cheated on or played with. I think this is really clever of the to put out such a serious album after Love Yourself Her which was more bouncy and about lighter topics. I admire the contrast they went for and I know that they gave their all to this song.Begin (Wings) As a Jungkookie biased ARMY, I’m not only putting this one on the list because my Kookie sings it, but also because it tells of how much the members influenced him and helped him blossom into the man he is today. This is a beautiful topic for the maknae of the group, seeing as he was so young when they first debuted. Jungkook says that because of the members, “Now I’m me. You make me begin. Smile with me. Cry with me. Fly with me.” This is so amazing and it just brings tears to my eyes to hear of how much Jungkookie appreciates his hyungs. They really truly helped him bloom, and this is one of the best topics BTS has ever sang about.

Here are a list of my 5 types of songs: Soul Songs: Just those songs that sings with the melody of your soul, the everlasting heartbeat pounding in your chest, and the rhythm and feeling of euphoria. Mic Drop (Steve Aoki Remix) - I don’t know how to explain this song. It’s gorgeous, never-tiring, and please… listen to it everyday for good grades and mental health. The beat is the melody of my heart.Idol - it’s the pounding of your heart. The side of you that gives the middle finger and no f*cks about anything. It’s the side that tells everyone else that you love yourself, which is what makes you superior to everyone else.Heart Clenchers: The songs that have a melody, lyric, and tune that makes your heart clench and your soul melt. The songs that make your heart beat faster but slows time down. Jamais Vu - This was the song that absolutely shocked me. ‘Remedy’ and ‘melody’ are the most beautiful rhymes that sing with the soul of each member of BTS. Their careers, their futures, their remedy, our remedy– all come from our fandom’s melody, and the music that they put their soul in.Heartbeat - this was an obvious one. This song reminds me of those angst romance fanfics I used to read (and still do) about heartbreak, death, cheating and above all else–the heart clench and rhythm of one’s heart while they are feeling and bearing pain. The lyrics are absolutely magical.Serendipity - my heart song. The song that my heart sings with whenever I heart it. The voice and lyrics that draw back and forth like the waves and the moon.Love Maze - borderline sexy voice…?Freeing Melodies: The melodies that set you free with the song’s very soul. Epiphany - “I’m the one I should love” sung in a chorus, in a stadium of 40,000 ARMY, all united to support seven boys, their dreams, their career, their music, and their emotional lifelines that they portray through their voices and melodies– tell me that isn’t the most beautiful thing in the universe. Whoever mentioned Epiphany on Instagram, I applaud you for doing so. There’s nothing like “I’m the one I should love” being sung at the Rose Bowl Stadium, nothing like the echo though the conjoining hearts of us all in the world, nothing like beauty in loving ourselves through the music BTS connects us with.Let Go - the most beautiful melody in the entire universe.Bangtan Bops: The songs that you will never let go because they are forever the head boppers of the music industry. Trivia: Just Dance - that bop that your body will always move to.Ma City - sung from the soul of each member.Crowd Chanters A little bit of generic tunes, but still amazing nevertheless. I would say IDOL and Spring Day. Spring Day was one of the most meaningful songs to me. The song pays homage to the victims and survivors of the Sewol Ferry Incident, an incident that remains a scar to many Koreans to this day. I am actually the age of the high school students who comprised the majority of the victims of this incident. The fact that they could have been my friends one day if it wasn’t for that incident hurts me. Every time I think of the incident makes bitter, sad, and hateful. I’m sure quite a lot of Koreans are like me in regards to that incident because not only are they fellow Koreans but they’re someone’s children, grandchildren, and friends. In a Confucianist society like Korea, that sentiment is especially strong. The song soothes that part of bitterness and sadness. The song Spring Day not only pays homage to the victims but also soothes the pain of people in regards to that incident.  I liked IDOL (without Nicki Minaj featuring, not that I don’t like her but I found her featuring to be unnatural. It didn’t quite fit in well.) because not only were the lyrics meaningful, but also it had good strong beats and was more ‘Korean’ than other songs I’ve heard. It had this thing I would call the Korean ‘흥’ (pronounced ‘heung’). 흥 generally means the idea of being in joy/having a good time but often associated with music. It’s that feeling of you wanting to move your body in response to a song. Traditional Korean music would often have a strong beat as we often use traditional drums called 북 and people would say 얼쑤 (a phrase included in IDOL) whilst dancing to the rhythm. IDOL is a modern version of typical traditional Korean music. Their choreography also incorporates some traditional Korean dance. (http://korea.net/NewsFocus/Culture/view?articleId=162979)

Originally Answered : Which BTS song do you never get tired of? Depends on my mood. But in general, I can never get sick of these songs : Outro: Tear (RM, Suga, j-hope) There’s just so much emotion, so much pain, so much heartache behind this song. As many of you may know, Yoongi wrote this song during one of the toughest times for BTS. The group was seriously considering disbanding, and when he played the song for the other members, they cried together. Whenever I feel down, I listen to this song, and it actually helps me feel better. If BTS, one of the biggest groups in the world, was able to get past their stress and anxieties to work together and succeed, I can too. Go Go Although a lot of people dislike this song, I actually find it addictive to listen to. As you can see in the picture, I loved the Halloween dance practice to Go Go almost as much as the song, haha. The melody and lyrics might sound meaningless and unvarying, but it has an important message behind it — how this generation is hyping and following the YOLO concept without actually thinking things through. They blow their money and time on useless things instead of appreciating and focusing on what’s actually important. Essentially BTS was mocking young people today about wasting the most precious thing — youth. Love Maze The rapping was immaculate. Vocals were amazing. I would consider it one of BTS’ more underrated songs. It’s vaguely in the center in the spectrum, maybe leaning more towards the underrated side. But I like it. A lot. There’s something about BTS’ love songs that are less cheesy and generic compared to other K-pop songs. It has some kind of message, theme, or significance behind it that takes awhile to understand. Epilogue: Young Forever Another tear-evoking HYYH song. I know the lyrics are ‘forever, we are young’, but there might be something else. BTS has been around for 7 years. I don’t know about you, but that’s a long period of time. It feels especially long if you experience the amount of hate and negativity BTS receives every day. Still, they stick together, focus on the positive, and work their hardest to please the non-toxic, faithful ARMYs. To me, this song is their way of promising us, “We’ll be with you forever. No matter what, we’re here. Even if we disband and don’t make music anymore, I hope that our 7 years of work in the music industry influences you and helps you.” It could also just be a simple reminder from BTS telling us to never let go of our youth. Make the most of it. Be happy with what you are and what you have. Keep chasing your dreams and never give up. That sounds cliche but sometimes you forget the most important reminders. everythingoes (RM, NELL) This song hit me right in the feels the moment I heard it for the first time. I can’t get over Namjoon’s soothing, raspy-ish voice. The lyrics sort of repeated itself, but still. It just sounds so good, I don’t know what else to say haha. Friends (Jimin, V) Ahhh!! I can’t explain how much I love this song! The beat, the melody, the lyrics, the perfect harmonies, everything. Taehyung and Jimin’s vocal range and tone are basically opposites, so they sound so heavenly together! This has to be one of my favorite BTS duets.  That’s all! This has been in my drafts for at least a week, but what can you expect from me? goodbye, adios, hasta la vista, au revoir, peace. ➶➶*•♡ 🄳🄸🄰🄽🄴 ♡•*➷➷

One main reason why I appreciate BTS is because they don’t narrow down their lyrical scope to the few usual topics like love, heartbreak, girls and parties. If you single out any album from their discography, its evident how different one song is from the other in terms of sound, lyrics and theme. There are plenty of songs which touched me, inspired me and left me in awe. So I’m just gonna list out a few: Epiphany: Where do I even start describing this song. I was waiting for the Jin solo intro for ages and it turned out to be hauntingly beautiful. I felt this final intro for Love Yourself series was so suitable because he finally realizes that he wants to love himself first. (Go check out the MV as well as fancams of him singing this live. Jin is a gem.) “It's so odd, I loved you so much for sure I adapted myself entirely to you, I wanted to live for you But as I kept doing so, I became unable to bear the storm inside my heart I got to fully reveal my true self under the smiling mask I'm the one I should love in this world The shining me, the precious soul of mine I realize only now, so I love me Though I'm not perfect, I'm so beautiful I'm the one I should love. ”  Spring Day: This song makes me feel happy and sad at the same time. Beautiful tune. Sad lyrics. There's melancholy in their voices while expressing the desperation and longing for that special someone. Adding to this is the beautiful mv with rich imagery and pastel colors. There are theories about how this song might be about the Sewol ferry disaster. Definitely feels more than just a simple love song. “The morning will come again Because no darkness, no season Can last forever.”  Spine Breaker: I know, it's hard to actually take this song seriously after that ridiculously hilarious music video that the boys made (genius choreography) but the lyrics are pretty cool because they talk about how the society works these days. “The class system of the 21st century is divided into two: Those who have and those who haven’t Those who wear the shoes and those who don’t Those who have the clothes and those who don’t And those who try hard to get those things Even after seeing your parents’ curved spines, you’re so cold-hearted You complain that all your friends have it and that they should buy it for you (Ayo baby) stop being so immature You won’t freeze just because you don’t have that jacket Fill your head with good sense before it’s too late Some of us can.”  Tomorrow: This song talks about how there may be hurdles thrown in your path to success and how you might be disheartened by that but you gotta keep moving on. I love how all these songs about struggles to succeed in life comes from their own struggles. “Follow your dream like breaker. Even if it breaks down, Don’t ever run backwards, never. Because the dawn right before the sun rises is the darkest.”  Paradise : I love how they assure you that it's okay to not have a big dream. Even if you don't make it big, you are unique. “Who says a dream must be something grand?Just become anybodyWe deserve a lifeWhatever, big or small, you are you after all.”  Wings: Another underrated song which compares career to having wings. “My back hurting is for my wings to come out I believe in you, even if things are bleak right now The end will be great Fly, fly up in the sky Fly, fly get ’em up high It’s the path you chose, dude don’t be scared This is just the first flight”  Love Myself : A feel good song which makes you happy. Beautiful harmonies. Great lyrics “Loving myself might be harderThan loving someone elseLet’s admit itThe standards I made are more strict for myselfThe thick tree rings in your lifeIt’s part of you, it’s youNow let’s forgive ourselvesOur lives are long, trust yourself when in a maze When winter passes, spring always comes.”  Love(RM) : I LOVE play on words. And Namjoon is the master of word plays (Saram-Sarang). “I just feel it Like the moon rises after the sun rises Like how fingernails grow Like trees that shed their bark once a year That you are the one who will give meaning to my memories Who will make a 'person' into 'love' Before I knew you My heart was filled with straight lines only I'm just a human, human, human You erode all my corners And make me into love, love, love”  Cypher, Ddaeng: Savage BTS pumps me up. Makes me wanna work hard and flex on haters like they are doing it at the moment. Their glow up is so inspiring. “The sound I’m making right now, baeIs all dog noise to someone, baeYou should change your bashing pattern, baeIt’ll start to get boring, boring baeI don’t dislike you anymoreI don’t dislike you anymore, sorry baeI’ll be the drum, just hit me hardLet’s just try it, samulnori, baeI’m a monster, my tail is too long, baeYou’ll shoot me anyway, baeIn that case, a zoo would be more comfortable, baeYou want it too, something to chew on, baeEven if you don’t like me, you know meEven if you don’t like me, you know meI like hate comments more than no commentsI don’t know youBut you know my name I love I love I love myself” (Cypher pt. 4) “Face that fell asleep after eating ramen ddaengDregs do your thangLook at me I'm your errthangYou're dope? Cool? RidiculousThere is no uh- ridiculousEven if I st-st-stutter my wordsI h-hope you understandI la-la-lack a way with wordsBu-but I try to speak correctly but my mouth keeps ge-ge-getting crookedBecause I li-li-li-like it I li-like it very muchRappers who don't even have haters, shut upWhere are you haters?Look into this mirror after washing your eyes and faceThere is a hater of yours breathing right in thereWe celebrate rather than being celebsOnly accel no breakWho are you to recognize meFrogs who live up to your nameI hope you die in that wellI'll pray earnestlyDdaeng” (Ddaeng)  There are many other songs with great lyrics. This list could be pretty long. These are just a few songs I admire (no particular order). Do give bts a chance. They're more than just “Top social artists” and “pretty Korean boys who dance well”.

Hmm… this is a hard one, so I’m going to choose more than one:) 5: Pied Piper I really don’t have anything to say about this except for this song being FREAKING CATCHY and I love how Namjoon’s part is straight up dissing some ARMYs (could be me, IDK)I also have to say, Jungkook biaswrecked me HARD when I saw them perform. Overall, great song.  4: Young Forever This is a great song with a great message. I gotta admit, I got teary eyed for quite a few times after listening to this song. I’m someone who usually gives up easily, even though it gives me many regrets. This song always helps me when I feel helpless and gives me hope of actually starting to do something I loved.  3: Spring Day This was the song that made me want to learn their names and enter the Kpop world. At first, I just liked the melody and the visuals. Soon after reading the English translations, and seeing multiple articles written about the meaning behind this song made me love this song even more. My grandma had just passed away as I found this song. With the lyrics surrounding the idea of missing someone whom we lost really helped me heal.  2: Epiphany When this song came out, the lyrics really touched me. During that time, I was having trouble with telling myself that I was worth it, that I was enough for my family and the world. Every-time I listen to this song, I always tell myself to remember to love myself first if I’m loving someone right now (LOL Namjoon’s UNICEF speech). Also, with Jin being my bias kinda helped with this high ranking ;P  (HOW IS HE THAT BEAUTIFUL) 1: Intro: Never Mind This song is SUPER UNDERRATED in my opinion. When I first found this song, I was trying really hard to push myself to do something that my parents wanted me to do and I was becoming more and more depressed and even had some thoughts that wasn’t so great. Whenever I felt like I couldn’t do it, I would listen to this song to comfort myself. These two lines hit me the most: “If you feel like you are going to crash then accelerate more, you idiot” and “We’re too young and immature to give up, you idiot. Never Mind”  (Eventually my parents saw that I was NOT happy and started to understand how I was feeling mentally… So I had quit the thing I was dreading to stop doing) So Here’s my list:) I could go on but I’d like to keep my answer relatively short

I’m later than the White Rabbit, but it had to be said. My favourite BTS song is, without a doubt, Spring Day. Not only the meaning behind the song, and the song itself, but how the song affected me. There isn’t much to say, honestly. Wait no, I take it back, let me tell you my life story. The person who introduced me to BTS in late 2018 is a huge ARMY, and this was their favourite song. They’re my best friend and so, me being cheap and not wanting to buy an actual present (yay), decided to learn this ‘dumb Korean song’ for their birthday, and I would sing it to them. Okay so iT wAs A LoT HaRdEr ThAn i ThOUgHt. As a person who somewhat despised K-pop at the time (yes, ‘the boys wear so much makeup, they all look the same, ew’), it was only my dedication to my friend that kept me from playing Subway Surfers on my phone on our 6-hour road trip. Lol after six hours, I could barely memorize the chorus, let alone the rest of the song, WHAT A FAILURE. Anyway so my friend’s birthday came around, and I dragged them to a corner and sang the stupid song, really quietly so nobody could hear except them. They were really happy (which made up for the horrible embarrassment I had suffered). They asked me to do one more thing for their birthday (WHAT MORE COULD YOU WANT), which was to listen to 3 other BTS songs. So came along Idol, Go Go, and DNA. Anyway, needless to say, after a few months I was an ARMY. Not warm-blooded or cold-blooded, ARMY-blooded. I lived BTS. Looking back, it was kinda creepy lol. And in summer 2019, I realized BTS and Blackpink were not the only K-pop groups. And I became a multi-stan. And now, BTS has a very special place in my heart. Spring Day has an even more special place in my heart. They may never be my absolute and only favourites again, but they were the first ones. Okay this got way deeper than I thought.  The morning will come again. No darkness, and no season, is eternal. ~Spring Day TL;DR: My ARMY BFF introduced me to BTS and Spring Day, I fell into the K-pop hole, I will never be the same. Okay lol stay safe, happy, and healthy, and I’ll see you soon <3

So, it is really hard to choose a favorite BTS song in my opinion, because they tend to bring out new sounds and lyrics in their songs, catching everyone by surprise constantly. What I CAN do however, is talk about my top 8 songs (No Particular Order) Young Forever - Run BALLAD MIXI can’t begin to tell you how much i play this song on repeat. I love the classical instruments used, I love RM and J-Hope singing, I love V’s husky voice with the violin. Maybe it’s the fact that Jimin and Jungkook’s voices in the hook was so lovely together, and the background vocals, but it’s definitely an all time favorite. 2. Serendipity (Full Length + Original) This was the music video that made me a Jimin-stan in the first place (Believe it or not, I used to be down for V). His voice just sounded so angelic and soft with the music, it’s so soothing. The music vidoe was so aesthetically pleasing, with all the warm colors and the overall softness with amazing to watch. I honestly did not think I needed a full length, until I heard it however. Although the part does repeat in the beginning of the new addition, I really REALLY love the addition of the guitar. I think it really completes the soft aesthetic look as well as compliments his voice. And don’t get me started on the new set of lyrics + a high note? Oh my G- 3. Trivia: Seesaw THIS IS MY BOP, I SWEAR ON THE HEAVENS! I was very surprised to hear this coming from Yoongi, but let me tell you my ears were absolutely blessed. Not only was he singing (Whoever says that he can’t sing, post up), his voice giving me the chills, but the music and his rap style was amazing as well. But I think personally the highlight of the song was not from Yoongi, but from the BigHit female producer, Adora (even tho I originally thought the female voice was Jimin, oof). Her voice is absolutely beautiful, and with her little notes in the background of Yoongi’s voice, it’s so PRETTY. I find myself replaying her parts alot, it’s so lovely to listen too. 4. Blood Sweat & Tears Don't get me started on their outfits. The whole Wings Era was just downright sexy, and I just ugh-. Anyways, I LOVE LOVE LOVE Jimin’s first step of verses in the song, because he just sounds so graceful and pretty. I enjoyed J-Hope alot as well in that MV as well as musically. Not mention that lovely climax by Jin. 5. FAKE LOVE Originally, I did like the song, but not as much as I do now. Not only was the MV dark and dreary to show their angst, but the vocals and dance moves were on it too. V….V in the beginning, oh my god. His voice was so haunting and deep and I was just in love. Main Manz Jin had so many lines, I was really crying for him. I REALLY LOVED HOBI’S VERSE THO, I loved the tempo to it and how spaced out it was. The dancing on it too was really great and on point. 6. 134340 (Pluto) Arguably, this might be my favorite BTS song of all time currently. I am a typically lyric junkie, so if you use metaphors to describe something and it makes sense? Yeah, you’ve probably caught my attention. Not only was the concept of Pluto being used as a metaphor for love, but the singing was so great as well. I especially really like Jungkook’s little voice jumps in the hook, it just sounds so good. The music is so jazzy and just really gives me good vibes. Not to mention Yoongi’s legendary rap with the phone call. 7. House of Cards This song is like sex to my ears. It’s so jazzy and deep, it’s hard to explain the sound for me. Not only did my boy Jimin have alot of lines, they really used his voice well with the blending of the other vocals too. Jin saying “No way, Now way..” and I’m like, Yes there is no way you can be so talented. Or when Jungkook says “…Slow Down” in the beginning of the climax ( and to whoever did the little “Ahhs” in the back, you’re freaking amazing) I was just really shooketh. 8. Butterfly (Original + Prologue Mix) It’s just a calming song, I don’t know why, it just is. I love how light their voices in this, it’s just nice and soft. “Is it true? Is it true?” (Favorite Lyrics of the song). I really love the remix too, it was an interesting sound and it was just so calming.

BTS discography is so rich and they have jewels hidden in it. I love many songs of BTS. Their songs are inspirational and the meaning is out of the box. I can connect to their songs easily. My 4 personal favourite songs which have my emotions connected to them : BUTTERFLY : This song is your expression to a suicidal person whom you love a lot. They are singing that they don't want to lose that person. Ever. Butterfly is fragile and they wish that losing you is just a fragile dream like a butterfly. GOGO : This fun song is highly misinterpreted song of BTS. This song is actually like a wake up call to the Procrastinators and today's young generation. They are indirectly taking a dig at those young people who only dream of becoming rich but don't work towards their goal cause their perception towards “You Only Live Once” is completely wrong. So when they sing “YOLO (x3) Ya”, they are taking a dig at such people who only believe in YOLO but meanwhile spend their time partying and still ask for money. (This is a funny video of them dancing on GOGO song. If you have never watched it, do watch. But warning, it will make you lose your brain cells.) SERENDIPITY : This gender neutral song about expressing your love to your loved one. It was a serendipity that both of them fell for each other. Hence, it's not a coincidence that Universe has brought them together because they were meant to be together. This song is calm and lyrics are beautiful. You would be left with a warm fuzzy feeling after listening to this one😋😉😏 I Need You : This song has 2 meanings. The most renowned talks about the difficulties you face when you enter adulthood. While the latter one is about a boy who has just experienced break-up, but in the MV there is no sign of any girl. Interesting? This song is metaphorical. They used metaphors of a boy's break-up to describe the struggles of leaving youth phase and entering the adulthood. Bye —

Oou, I love this question. I would say…. Spine Breaker. I don’t know what it is about this song, but it makes me think about my mom and how she tries really hard to support my siblings and I. As a kid, I really took advantage of that. Fashion trends were kind of trashy back then. 😬 I really wanted a lot of things and didn’t care how she got it. I just wanted it. It was a good thing that my mom didn’t take BS from my siblings and I because she would put us in our place if we complained about wanting a certain item that was too expensive. Being older now, I’m grateful that she told us that we couldn’t get it because we had necessities. So all the money would go to the bills, food, transportation, essentials for school, etc. I didn’t need that red lipstick, or that handbag as much as I needed our necessities. That doesn’t mean that she didn’t us stuff. We would often get surprised by her when she bought us fast food or got us nail polish or toys. I know it’s not a lot but it really meant a lot to us at that time. And it because of that it taught me how to use my money on things that are important first and the extras would go to my own personal use. But on the other hand, there are kids or even adults who take advantage of them and learn later on. Or even worse, not at all. Spine breaker is really a good song about kids not being grateful about what their parents or guardians do for them. You’re parents or guardians buy you all the things that you want but find out that it’s just not enough. If they can get you this, then surely they can get you more. Then greed starts to set in, but you don’t even notice. You want to be known as the one at school who’s up to date on the fashion trend, turning a blind eye on the one who worked extra hours just to get you those things. “Wow, it feels good, putting on your dirty clothes” That’s the part of the lyrics that get to me the most. It can be the most expensive clothes from Gucci to whatever fashion brand and still be dirty. Why? Because if you look deeper and see the parent/guardian working extra hours just to give their kids the most nicest jewelry, outfits, etc. and then look at the child who knows how tired they are and yet still persists to get other expensive things. It’s really hard, especially if you don’t have a lot of money. “You can keep your swag on but how about your parents?” Please be grateful to them. Show that you love them and care, it can go a long way. P.s Spine breaker is a song about kids who are not grateful to their parents. They can look at their curves spines and still want more from them despite them being tired. I just wanted to clarify, just in case someone misinterpreted what I was trying to come across. P.s.s I’m sorry about my grammar and punctuation. It’s my second time answering a question. What’s your favorite BTS song and why? Please comment I would like to read your answers.  ~ Naoe is out. Peace.

It's hard for me to choose. I usually listen to their songs according to my mood. When I'm sad or just feeling a bit melancholic, I'll listen to Awake, First Love, and Stigma. When I need some energy, I'll listen to Fire, Dope, and Mic Drop. But when it comes to songs I can play anytime, I pick these: Rain: probably the most underrated song ever. I love the strong jazzy vibes and the sound of the pouring rain they put in it. The lyrics is also very relatable. BTS said that above all else, they are musicians. And I think this song explains it very well. They are basically saying that sometimes, musicians aren't always full of inspirations as it always seems. But somehow the lack of inspiration itself inspire them to create wonderful lyrics. I often think that this song is so sophisticated it doesn't sound very K-Pop to me at all.The Truth Untold: if you're familiar with the lyrics, I believe you understand. They made this song based on a story about a man in a castle who falls in love with a girl he sees plucking the flowers in his garden everyday for her to sell. He decided to plant the most beautiful flower ever so the girl can sell it for higher price but she never shows up the next day and he regrets his decision never to see her in person, because he believes that he's too ugly. The origin story is beautiful enough, but I strongly believe that this song is actually about the truth they couldn't tell the ARMYs: they could never show us their true side. As an idol, they're afraid their real self is ‘too ugly' that it couldn't meet our expectations. But even so, they will always try their best to create ‘the most beautiful flowers' (songs, music videos, albums) for us because they love us anyway. Feel free to cry.Sea: this song is particularly special because it's a hidden track, which means this song isn't listed in the original tracklist of Love Yourself: Tear, and can only be heard once you play the album until the very end. This song describes their fame as a sea; it's so beautiful that you think the abundance of water can wash away your thirst (a will to succeed, in this case), but once you got there, you realized that the more you drink, the thirstier you get. They also explain the struggles they have to face to get to this point in some less metaphorical words. I think it takes only the best lyricist to create such masterpiece.That's that, I hope I didn't just bore you with my long expositions.

fake love. This song is ICONIC, they really snapped with this one. The instrumental is flawless, the lyrics hits you like a truck, and the rap and vocals is on top. My favorite song, like, not just in kpop. It means so much to me. And the choreo, goshhhh. This song is 10/10Boy in luv (IN luv, not with). I feel like I’m picking one sibling over the other loool. I love boy with luv, it’s amazing! But boy in luv will always have a special place in my heart. The bad boy + school concept is cool, the rap is slapping soo hard, vocals as well. But! The! Choreo! Is! The! Best! One! Ever!I’m a sucker for rap line, so third place goes to outro:tear. They snapped on that one. They are singing ffs!!! RM goes offfff in the beginning, Suga takes over with those bars and J-Hope finish it with such a great flow. Love it.Boyz with fun. That song is so fun, you immediately get on a good mood while listening to it. And the chorus is so catchy, it’s a song I’d sing and full on dance to in the shower. That’s the best way to describe it.2nd Grade!! Is! Freaking! Legendary! As well as boyz with fun, the chorus is so addictive, I will mumble the lyrics and melody from time to time, and the rap!! It’s so swaggy (yup just came up with that word)Best Of Me. This one is so underrated!! It’s so beautiful. The melody, the choreo.. but when Namjoon starts singing-ish rapping-Ish, I loose it every time. It’s so good!Love vocal line. The seventh spot is for the one and only The Truth untold. They sound like angels I swear to god if I’m in a sad mood I’ll start crying listening to that song.MIC DROP. But it’s the Steve Aoki remix. The original is okay, but it’s AMAZING with the remix. The MV is so good. The song slaps. Don’t know what more to say.The song has just been out for a few days but I have to include it, it’s so freaking beautiful - heartbeat. When I heard it for the first time I thought I would cry, the instrumental works so well with their voices. And Tae in the beginning, ahhh. I’m dead.I can’t really decide on this one so I’ll just insert some honorable mentions, legendary songs. QUEEN spring day, I NEED U, blood sweat and tears, EPIPHANY (stream epiphany cowards). And lights! I know it’s in Japanese and not released yet but the teaser freaking snaps. I love it.

LOL trust me love, I can never pick one even if my life depended on it - I love all their songs equally. However, if I had to tell you about my BTS music tastes, I would say I am more of a big fan of BTS’s lyrics and how deep they can be. Furthermore, I am also more attracted to songs with deeper meaning and lyrics rather than stuff just like DNA or their more “pop” songs. You’ll notice that a good portion of these songs have been rapped / produced by Namjoon and Yoongi, especially the latter for his deep and heartbreaking lyrics, whom has continued to inspire me daily. If I narrowed it down to one single playlist (in no particular order): •The Last - Agust D •First Love - Suga •Truth Untold - BTS •All Cyphers + Mic Drop (I like to refer to this as one series of songs) •I Love You - Jin •Tomorrow - BTS •Run - BTS •2!3! - BTS •Intro: Never Mind - BTS •Epilogue: Young Forever - BTS •So Far Away - Agust D •Awake - Jin •Reflection - RM •Spring Day - BTS •Outro: Tear - BTS •Magic Shop - BTS •Airplane Pt. 2 - BTS •Anpanman - BTS •Arirang - BTS cover •Someone Like You - V cover •Hug Me - V x JHope cover • 4 o’ Clock - V x RM cover •Agust D - Agust D •Born Singer - BTS •Life - RM •God Rap - RM •Joke - RM •Even If I Die, It’s You - Hwarang OST - V x Jin •Fake Love - BTS As of right now, if you asked me to pick 3 songs to forever listen on repeat, they would be: •The Last - Agust D •Truth Untold - BTS •Spring Day - BTS Hope this helps! If you are a new ARMY, I highly suggest you listen to these songs, which more than also deserve the same hype as Fake Love. I stand firmly by the fact that Spring Day as well as the HYYH era deserve the same hype as our queen LY: Tear. Happy listening! Where do I start… Though I like a considerable number of their recent songs, I’ve always been a huge fan of their old(er) songs. So a lot of my favorites will lean in the older direction. [Note: These songs aren’t in chronological order. I just wrote them down whenever I thought of one I liked.] Examples include, but aren’t limited to: N.O. [As I’m a student, this song spoke a lot to me.]No More Dream [Claaaaassic.]Just One Day [Idk why but this song gives me nostalgia… which is funny considering how I became an ARMY circa one/two years (?) after it came out…]Can You Turn Off Your Phone? [So underrated. So good. So applicable to today.]Converse High [SO CATCHY.]I Like It [BTS songs have a thing about getting stuck in your head. I like it.]Rain [Kind of emo vibes… really good!]For You [From a Japanese mini album… I don’t understand the words but like… lyrically, it’s so appealing. Also, JK looks particularly hot in it. ]2nd Grade [Not a lot of people know this song… but holy crap it’s good!]Moving On [As someone who’s moved a lot, this song was really relatable.]Let Me Know [Jimin’s high note…]Coffee [I don’t even like coffee but I like it when this song comes on lol]Attack On Bangtan [This is a bop, and no one can convince me otherwise.]Jump [Very angsty… an all-around masterpiece.]Hold Me Tight [From I Need You era. In regards to the overall message of the song, it’s similar to I Need You.]Outro: Love is Not Over [Ahhhhhhh this song makes me feel weirdly reminiscent.]Autumn Leaves [Listen to this and you’ll get why it’s on this list.]Young Forever [THE CHORUS AND THE RAP AND EVERYTHING MAKES ME FEEL SO ATTACKED I CAN’T EVEN]House of Cards [No, guys, it’s not about sex. It’s about a doomed relationship.]팔도강산 [Idk the title in English… I just find this song so funny… Maybe it’s cause I’m Korean.]2!3! [The WINGS era. Part of me still can’t believe it’s over…ㅠㅠㅠ]Pied Piper [I. Swear. I think everyone will agree with me when I say that this song is the nicest way ARMYs have ever been told to get a life. And by BTS, no less.]Lost [Vocal line killing it here.]First Love [My personal favorite of the the seven solo Wings era songs. Genius.]Epiphany [Because Jin? And sad lyrics?]Aaaaaand sorry this is getting long. I’ll just end with my all-time favorite:SPRING DAY [I cry.]

This is soooo hard. It’s basically impossible for me to rank top 10 favorite BTS songs, but here are my top 10 songs in no particular order: Not Today - I first started listening to this song back in January 2018 and really fell in love with its strong beat (my favorite type of Kpop songs). The music video and choreo is also really cool. Fire - this is such an amazing dance bop and has a really cool rhythm. Mic Drop - I listen to the dance break (long) version of this song and I can never get over that part lol Anpanman - this is such a unique and upbeat song, and watching BTS’ stage performance videos of this song just makes me love this song even more. Fake Love - previously I didn’t love this song as much, but as I listen to it more I start to love this track more and more. This unique hit is the perfect combination of ballad rhythms and dance beats. I Need U - I remember Jimin saying that he really loves this song, and I really do love this ballad as well. There’s so much emotion in this track and it’s just such a powerful, beautiful song! Butterfly - who doesn’t love deep, beautiful BTS ballads, right? This is another beautiful ballad by BTS and definitely underrated. Make It Right, Jamais Vu and Dionysus - I am still in deep love with BTS’ latest EP, and these are my favorite 3 songs from MOTSP. I enjoy Make It Right’s smooth R&B vibe, Jamais Vu’s deep-meaning lyrics and rhythm, and Dionysus’ unique beat. I’m definitely missing out on some other amazing tracks by BTS (like their solo songs are so beautiful too…), but these are my top 10 BTS songs :)

My favourite BTS songs (in this order) are: Dope; DNA; Fake Love; Blood, Sweat and Tears; Run; War of Hormone; I Need U and Save Me. Dope - The overall feel of the song, and the fact that you get to hear a decent amount of each member’s voice, makes it perfect for new ARMYs.DNA - I like this song because of the layers of voice shared between the members, you get to experience a range of pitches from each.Fake Love - The deep voices used in the chorus make it seem mysterious, before the pitch ascends into a higher state and they shoot into solo parts.Blood, Sweat and Tears - The high notes used here from the like of Taehyung and Jimin are balanced out completely by the deeper tones from the likes of Yoongi and Hoseok.Run - It’s slow at first but gains speed as the song goes on, and the slower tempo combined with the variety of high and low pitches makes it a feelgood song.War of Hormone - It’s one of the more comedic songs they’ve made, talking about the struggles a teenage boy goes through during puberty when he starts to look at girls in a different perspective.I Need U - It’s a slower song that portrays the relationship between a couple who have recently broken up, containing lines like ‘I’m sorry (I hate you), I love you (I hate you), Forgive me’. The male is trying to win the woman back after he has been broken by the fall of the relationship.Save Me - Last but not least, this song is mostly higher tones but there are also deeper tone provided by the likes of Namjoon and Hoseok. It talks about someone who feels trapped in an eternal darkness and wants to be free, asking for someone’s hands to save them from it.This was a list of my favourite BTS songs and what they mean.

Thank you for requesting my answer. Choosing a favorite song from BTS isn’t just a black or white option because they have so many great songs. But I will try my best to narrow it down to 10. Tomorrow : This song helped calm me a lot during days wherein I was unemployed. I was feeling helpless and useless but this song was my comfort.Intro: Nevermind: My go-to confidence booster!Paradise: Such a nice song, talking about how to cherish life and take things slowly. Sometimes our ambitions for great things eat us and make us believe that we have to run as fast as others but that’s not always the case. A dream is a dream whether it’s not as big as how others see it.Let Me Know: It’s a classic break up song but I love how the emotions were really riled up in one song. The lyrics and melody were very well made. Nothing but respect to Producer Min Yoongi.Spring Day: A nostalgic song about missing your loved ones. This song is one of their important songs. It’s very meaningful and sad but beautiful.I Need U: This song is memorable because it’s what converted me to be an ARMY.4 O’Clock: Taehyung’s voice is so good in here and one of the lyrics in Namjoon’s rap “We’re living and dying at the same time” got me in so deep. I love listening to this especially on quiet nights.Move: Makes me super emotional, the way they described how moving from one apartment to another isn’t just simply taking your stuff and leaving, it’s also leaving behind all your emotional baggages to pursue bigger things. Who knew moving could be so deep.Born Singer: Namjoon’s verse really gets me everytime. How he said he was afraid of not reaching people’s expectations hit me so hard. The whole song is also very sad, this is BTS’ reality when people barely paid attention to them and now look where they are now. I’m so proud of them.We On: ARMYs who left the fandom because they say BTS got arrogant after they released “MIC Drop” have probably never heard this song in their whole “ARMY” life. We On slaps and if people actually cared, BTS was always confident of their talent and skills whether before and now. Special Mention: Trivia: Seesaw, Epiphany, Lie, Magic Shop, The Last and Cypher Pt.2: Triptych. Anyway all BTS songs are good for me and it’s just a matter of mood on which one I listen for today~

I have quite a few favorites, so I’ll choose the ones that pop into my head rn. I might add others later. (these are in no particular order) Baepsae / Silver SpoonThis song was actually one of my first BTS songs. I listened to it for the first time when I was first getting into k-pop. I had previously known BTS for songs like DNA or Boy With Luv, so I really enjoyed listening to Baepsae because of how different it was then what I had previously known. I love how the song’s upbeat vibe is paired with the song’s true meaning. It’s just such a fun song to listen to when you’re bored or something. It never gets old. 2. Pied Piper This song is an absolute masterpiece. I love how the message of the song came off as sort of comical at first, but they are showing genuine care, just in a different way than most artists would. This song never fails to put me in a good mood. I also love when Pied Piper is performed live because obviously them v o c a l s, but also because it just means even more when performed live for some reason. It just shows the bond that BTS and Armys have really well. Kind of like Young Forever. 3. Blood, Sweat, and Tears I love this song and the music video for it. I know it’s quite a popular song, but I really enjoyed it. I really love the symbolism in the music video and the way the boys portrayed it, like most music videos. It’s just that type of that just makes you want to dance. 4. Euphoria This song is just beautiful. Bang Chan described this song perfectly, so here’s that.  Anyways, Euphoria is just the type of song that makes you feel happy. Jungkook’s vocals are obviously perfection, and the lyrics are so pretty. It inspires me when I’m feeling down or unmotivated. 5. Spring Day This song makes me really emotional, but I still love it. It is originally about losing a loved one and the song depicts that feeling very well in my opinion. I also interpret this song in a different way though and I really admire that about this song. You can apply it do different situations. The music video for this song is so pretty and I love when the boys perform this song live. These were just a few of my favorite BTS songs and I might add more later Anyways, bye <333

I'm not too into BTS, as in I haven't heard all of their album songs, solos or singles. So I can only make a list on their popular ones. Blood sweat and tears- the song which Introduced me to kpop. I fell in love with jimins falsetto. And the visuals and aesthetics of the music video were on a completely different level.Boy with luv- I loved that they embraced their femininity and elegance in this song. The pink outfits along with the pastel themes and their hair colours melted my heart.Save me - this was the perfect mashup of pop and melancholy for me.Not today- the beat and background music, especially that one repeating tune gave off a bollywoody feeling and thus I kept on listening to it more and more. The best chore ever I feel.Dope- I'm not a fan of rap( don't kill me)but this songs rap somehow made me want to listen to it over and over again. Oh and jin as doctor and jungkook as a police officer, dancing and thrusting like that gave me the feels.Idol- I loved jimins moves with the traditional handfan, and the choreo in the chorus was amazing. This was a really unique and catchy song for obvious reasons.Fire- what can I say the song was lit and it burnt my heart.Spring day- I can't get over its melody and the message.DNA- taehyungs visual and the choreo in the end were amazing. I loved the bridge very much.Boy in love: the music video did not age well with me, especially the scenes with the girl (cultural differences) but boy did the song pack a punch. And the ad libs and post chorus stuck in my mind.I hope this helps. Again these are my personal preferences and I hope I don't offend anybody.

Honestly for me, I listen to Magic Shop to make me feel better. Whenever I’m feeling down or just not having a good day or moment, I turn on Magic Shop. I turn it up until I can’t hear anything. The lyrics are so touching. You were the one that made your way to meI do believe your galaxyI want to listen to your melodyYour stars in the Milky WayDon’t forget that I found you anywaysAt the end of my despairYou’re the last reasonFor me who was standing at the edge of the cliffLive This song is basically about how ARMY helped BTS through all of their hardships and helped them become the successful and wonderful people they are today. The song is a way for ARMY’s to feel comforted and reassured. When we are in look of help or someone to be there, we can open a door in our heart, and BTS will be there in the Magic Shop. Here are some more of my favorite lyrics. Let's make a door. It's in your heart Open the door and this place will await Magic Shop While drinking a glass of hot teaAnd looking up at the Milky WayYou’ll be alright, oh, this here is the Magic Shop I feel like it’s not true that I wanted to be the bestI wanted to become your comfort and move your heartI want to take away your sadness, and pain Other songs I love to listen to when I’m a bit down is 2! 3! (Still Wishing For Better Days) and Whalien 52. 2! 3! is about erasing all of the bad memories you’ve had in the past, and take Bangtan’s hand and smile and laugh. It is also another comforting song in which ARMY’s can be able to feel relief after hearing it. It's okay, now when I say "one two three", forget it all. Erase those sad memories, let's take each other's hands and laugh. Even so, there will be good days ahead. If you believe my heart, one, two, three. For believing in the me who is like this, for dealing with these tears and wounds. So thanks. for becoming my light, for becoming the flower of our most beautiful moments. The song in its entirety is special to me and holds a lot of meaning to me. Whalien 52 is about the 52 Hertz whale. The whale has been known as the ‘Loneliest Whale’. The whale calls at a rather higher pitch than regular whales (52 HZ), calling at 10–39 HZ. Although you may be calling, whether it’s trying to stand up for yourself, you may not be heard. But continue to keep trying. BTS conveys that you will be heard if you just continue trying, even if you’re ignored or shrugged off. In the middle of the vast oceanOne whale speaks softly and lonelilyThe fact that no matter how much they shout, it won’t reach Edit: I also wanted to include 21st Century Girl and Butterfly. 21st Century Girl is about women empowerment and Butterfly is about a great love. Many will interpret these songs in a different way.

Gah, what an awful question! Ha! NOTE: I love pretty much every song BTS shares with us and think that my “favourites” are determined by my mood. But, below, I have given my top three because Samita is a cruel, cruel person and requested an answer and I shall oblige. 3. Magic Shop.  When I became an ARMY, I went through all of their music - I have RM’s, Suga’s and J-hope’s mixtapes, have listened to all of their cover songs, found “hidden” tunes like Sea and have been truly astounded by the range of styles BTS can present musically…but then I found Magic Shop. The melody is beautiful and every member does an amazing job - both live and in the album release - and the song just resonated with me. I could be cooking dinner and ta-da! There I am, singing Magic Shop for no other reason than it came to my head. To be corny, there is something magical about this song that just demands people love it - and, if you don’t…well, it’s your loss! 2. Mikrokosmos.  This song has so many plays on my iTunes and I can sing it word for word…badly, but I can, even if my Korean pronunciation is awful. Before knowing the lyrics, because I like to just enjoy music before reading about it, Mikrokosmos just made me feel happy and hopeful. It felt like everything was good and I think it was an ingenious idea to make this their concluding song during concerts, because people would leave BTS’ venue feeling like everything would be fine even if something (like the concert) had ended. It feels like it is filled with love and I was so pleased that it was also their concluding song during BTS Class of 2020 performance. 1. Crystal Snow.  I’m not sure I can explain the feelings I get from this song. Crystal Snow, after Moon, has the most plays on my iTunes and I can listen to it no matter my mood - happy, angry, upset, chill, bored: just put on Crystal Snow and everything seems right with the world. The whole piece, vocals and rap, is just so touching and I will love this song forever - my only peeve with this song is that there isn’t an MV to watch, which I’m convinced would be beautiful. None of my top three have MVs, I’ve just realised. That’s not on, BigHit! However, my most played and repeated song on my iTunes is… 0. Moon.  Jin, in my opinion, you’re welcome to disagree, is the Ballad King - Awake, Epiphany and his beautiful covers like Autumn Outside the Post Office prove that the beauty of his face is mirrored in his voice. But, then we throw in Moon - it’s pop, it’s fun, it’s heartwarming and dedicated to ARMYs, further proving just how wonderful Jin’s musical range has become. We all know Jin wasn’t trained as a singer until he joined BigHit and, while I’ve yet to hear a song where Jin sounded “bad” in their debut days, Jin’s voice has certainly gotten more powerful and more stable in the last few years which shows his determination to succeed as a vocalist. I love it, and its singer of course. P.S - Go check out JK proving how much he loves it too on YouTube - it’s so cute!  I could quite literally change this order (with the exception of Moon and Crystal Snow) to include songs like Your Eyes Tell, Spinebreaker, Friends, Euphoria, Cyphers, Epiphany, Spring Day, Sea, Converse High…I’ll stop or I’m just going to list every song in BTS’ catalogue, because they are all amazing. Thank you for the request. TTFN!

My favourite songs with all of the group in it is Fake Love, Dionysus, and Crystal snow. Why? Fake love is just because I like the song lol and same goes for Dionysus. The lyrics itself does not really apply to me but they are probably one of my favourite songs. I love the beat, singing, and everything. For crystal snow is for how beautiful it is, its sung so beautifully and it always leaves me smiling every time I hear it. Also, a lot of it has to do with Jin’s high note. Let's be honest, he OWNS that song hands down. My favourite songs as a solo is awake and epiphany. Jins songs has always been the ones that make me either tear up or full up cry when I hear them, and that's a lot because I practically listen to them everyday and still get the same reaction. Okay, lets be honest my bias is Jin. But his music is what made me bias him. Awake always leaves me crying because that's how JIN feels. He expresses his pain in that song and it always makes me emotional listening to it. For epiphany, this song also hits me hard. It expresses self love and I'm so insecure but when I listen to that song I just learn to…love myself? I don't know how to explain it, but “Im the one I should love in this world” is so true and basically what I quote to myself everyday. Epiphany is a wonderful song. Even though I love those songs, nothing can ever come past “So far away” Which is my favorite song out of bts. This song manages to be more than lyrics, capturing my feelings and making it into a song. It explains me so well and basically how I feel empty and doesn't have a dream. And although Jungkook’s and Jin’s voice in that song is FANTASTIC Suga’s lyrics hit hard and different. I never knew there was a song to explain how I am feeling. So yeah, so far away is my favorite.

Since 2013, the group has released more than 20 singles and has multiple chart-topping albums. While their discography could be daunting, if you want to enlist in their fan ARMY, there are a few BTS songs that you definitely need to take a listen to: 1. BTS - “Blood Sweat & Tears” (Wings, 2016) The newest single from BTS is innovative and the culmination of the group’s career so far. After preceding singles began the transition away from old-school hip-hop sounds, “Blood Sweat & Tears” completed the shift with one of the group’s most symphonic singles to date. It’s also one of BTS’ best-selling songs ever, and the lead single from the highest-charting K-pop album ever on the Billboard 200. That’s some serious street cred right there for a song that came out less than 10 days ago. 2. BTS - “No More Dreams” (2 Cool 4 Skool, 2013) They may have eschewed their athletic wear and heavy hip-hop sound in recent days, but “No More Dream” is still one of the most iconic BTS songs. The group’s debut song paved the way for the rest of BTS’ career with its energy and inspirational message. While the septet may have outgrown their original sound, it’s still a fan favorite that any BTS fan must know. 3. BTS - “Cypher Pt. 3: Killer” (Dark & Wild,2014) BTS has been able to set themselves apart from other K-pop acts by not simply incorporating short raps into their songs but instead seriously incorporating hip-hop into their overarching sound. There’s no better exhibit of the septet's dedication to hip-hop than the cypher tracks on several of their albums. The most popular is 2014’s “Cypher Pt. 3: Killer,” which was written by members Rap Monster, Suga and J-hope in collaboration with featured rapper and producer Supreme Boi. (Also check out “Cypher 4” on Wings.) The song’s disjointed rhythm and beats paired with the forceful lyrics and venomous raps is extraordinarily different from BTS’ most popular singles, but it’s where the depth of BTS is found.

I am unfamiliar with the acronym,BTS. I am curious with the way the question was worded, it assumes the reader would know such a thing, either intentional or unintentional. I am not suggesting malice or anything is salacious with the wording, I just thought it curious. That said, if it is a band name, I am therefore not a fan, however, if it is a shortening of the way one says Beatles these days, then my answer would be “A Day in the Life of” or “I’m Looking Through You.” The ‘why’ anyone has a favorite song is an esoteric experience by nature, cannot be conveyed by explanation alone, it is the feeling an individual has that is pertinent to ones experiences with the melody, and so I will attempt to disprove my asinine assumption. “A Day in the Life of” being a quintessential example of the way The Beatles are known for experimenting with a blending together of different genres of rock music and rhythm timing flawlessly without the audience realizing the timing shift, brilliant, awe inspiring and pragmatically beautiful as it is complex, a masterpiece of song and sound creation. “I’m Looking Through You” another example of The Beatles raw talent by creating a snappy and simple pop style early rock melody that has deeper meaning in the song than the jazz hands style melody suggest, example: ‘Why tell me why, did you not treat me right? Love has a nasty habit of disappearing overnight’ with just two simple lines of verse, sums up most relationship quarrels. Like I said, esoteric. One persons awe! Is another ones egads! Say what you will, without The Beatles and their influence, the music of today would not be the same.

This is such a hard question😭 I’d have to go with Black Swan though. That song was so perfect in my opinion. It was just a pretty song. I loved the choreography. I think it was cool that they tried more of a contemporary dance. I think the auto tune was a good fit for this song. I know a lot of people hate severe auto tune but on some songs I think it can make the song better. This was an example. I also loved the message behind it. The quote “A dancer dies twice, once when they stop dancing and the first is the more painful”. I thought it was cool how they related that quote to their passion for music. I liked that the message was a bit different from what they normally do. Overall, Black Swan is just amazing. My next favorite song is definitely either Tear or Tomorrow. Highly recommend them! Anyways, BTS’s self made album ‘BE’ out November 20th!! ~Liz

For sure it’s Dream Glow. But the other two tie in closely, as well. I guess Dream Glow for me is more enjoyable as it’s something I can actually jam out to, and dance to, to get me in a good mood. A Brand New Day is a chill song for me, something I’d put on if I wasn’t having a drink and sitting doing nothing, whereas All Night is, I guess something I’d put on occasionally for either chilling or dancing to. I don’t know, I have weird reasoning but those are my reasons. I can’t wait for the next song that they’ve done altogether as well! Generally I’m proud of all the songs and the collaborations as well that have already been so successful and also shows the talent of all the people involved.

Lie - JiminThe composition, the power, everything is absolutely perfect and it encompasses everything I’m feeling at each and every moment. 2. Paradise - BTS The production of the song is gorgeous in every single way and it never fails to make me vibe 3. We are Bulletproof: The eternal -RM Find me and ARMY who dislikes this song, I mean it just goes to show how much their truly grateful for this amazing fandom and what sort of idol dedicates an entire song (multiple songs actually) solely to their fans? BTS that’s who. 4. Intro: Person - RM I love rap and the rap line in BTS is amazing, probable one of the best in the industry but this song just encloses the special way in which RM sees the world. A lot of BTS songs have to do with identity and trying to figure out who they are but this and the next song are truly my favourites. 5. Interlude: Shadow - Suga What list would this be if I didn’t add this song. It shows how much Suga has grown, but has so many throwbacks to old lyrics from their very first album and his flow is just indescribable. 6. Outro: Ego - JHope Like I said, I love rap, but Ego is such a happy song and is quite technically difficult for someone who didn’t start off as a rapper. But I mean BTS loves this song as well and it’s not very hard to see. 7. Spine Breaker - BTS Whenever I hear this song I always think of the MV which is absolutely amazing. It just tells you how BTS went from having to record their MV’s all by themselves to having videos costing millions of won. And of course, Jin’s choreography is top-notch. 8. House of cards - Jin, Jungkook, V and Jimin I found it really hard trying to choose between this and Dimple, because the vocal line is just incredible in both. But this performance holds a special place in my heart because it was one of my first BTS lives that I had ever watched, and it was just stunning. 9. Serendipity - V The tonal quality in this song always blows me away. V’s voice is one of the most unique in the industry, and the huskiness in his sound is what makes this song absolutely magical. 10. Boyz with fun - bts This song is honestly such a throwback and it just sounds so fun and lively. I adore the maturity the current BTS brings to the stage these days as well as the beautiful and well thought out lyrics, but sometimes I live for the days they bring back these classics because the pure fun on the stage is just incredible to watch.
