Not an exaggeration, but BTS’ latest album, Map Of The Soul:7 is a real bop! All the songs are really good. RM also mentioned in his latest livestream on V app that how much effort was put in each and every track. It’s really difficult to choose a favourite track out of these bops. But ON, the title track is so catchy and it literally lifts up your mood within few seconds. “Black Swan” is so deep and it reflects the innear fear of an artist. Also, Friends (by Jimin and V), and Respect (by Suga and RM) are awesome too. As much as “Zero o’ clock”/00:00 is soothing and melancholic, “Louder than Bombs” is that much meaningful. Not to mention, how much emotional and deep “We Are Bulletproof: The eternal” is! And seriously speaking, all the single tracks are outstanding in their own ways. All of them reflect the members and their thoughts perfectly. So in conclusion, I love all of them. Stan BTS and stream ON and BLACK SWAN. 💜 Also, stay healthy.

Spring Day will always be my favorite song because it has this emotional connection for many people. It has a message that so many people can agree with and can relate to. The song has always been a song that I feel emotionally attached to from the second I heard it. Most other people will say their favorite song is DNA or Mic Drop or another song like that, but for me it will always be Spring Day since it is something that I listen to when I am feeling a little down. That song helps me get back into a good mood because I feel like it is a song that people think gets them and whatever they are going through. Even the English translation of the lyrics have a feeling that all of them understand what you have and are going through. So that is why Spring Day will always be my favorite BTS song and why I can’t really choose any other song over this one.

Hii, all of BTS’s discography is great. Of course, every song is great if it is by BTS! I can recite most of their songs by heart and know what they are generally about, but for me, these 10 are my favourite musically.

1-Airplane pt2:I love latino vibes in this song. My favourite part is J-hope's rap which is same with Airplane.And Jin’s part. 2-Dionysus:This song has rock n roll and more energetic vibes so I am in love with this song. 3-Blood Sweat And Tears:No need to talk about this song.Everybody knows this song is a golden. 4-Mic Drop(Remix version) :An awesome edm song. Favourite part is J-hope's rap and chorus part. 5-Spring Day:One of the best songs about missing someone.Only bad part about this song is J-hope is just doing back vocalising so I prefer live versions. I am addicted to this song. 8-Anpanman:I love this song esspecially live versions. 9-Louder than bombs-Jimin and Jin fits this song perfect. It also fits my music taste the best from what I listened to before K-Pop.Baspsae- I like the political message and I also love the soundRun- It’s just always been my favorite title track, I don’t know why. I really loved the MV and it sounds good and the lyrics.Cypher Pt. 3 and 4- I just really like the sound and the dissesLove Myself- It was just the first song that really managed to make me cry because I’ve wanted to cry listening to other songs but then the lyrics hit too close to homePromise/Epiphany/MAMA- Some of my favorite solo songs and they all made me cry

Epiphany. BTW, Epiphany is probably my best friend—the kind that listens to my every problem. Why? I’m one of those people who get anxiety when I listen to fast-paced songs (*cough* Dionysus *cough*), so Epiphany has that slow, relaxing feel to it. Epiphany has such a beautiful meaning to it. It’s definitely the song you’d listen to when you’re feeling depressed. I really like the instrument choice. Violins are really special to me, because I find that whichever song I listen to that has violins, it makes me emotional and happy. What does it mean to me? I’ve always felt such a connection to the song. Maybe it’s not as popular, but that just makes me feel like the song is all for me. I tend to get depressed really often nowadays,(2019 hasn’t been really kind to me/my family) so listening to this song makes me feel special. It literally ‘cures’ my depression. It, like, quenches my thirst for a song that understands me. How often I listen to it. Whenever I can. Happy or sad, the song is always there for me. But especially when I’m depressed.

I like Dynamite cause it is in English and I can understand it. Not only because of that, I felt the song having a funky genre which I like it sounds really fun and a song to dance to. As in Korean songs, I really love RUN! I don’t know why maybe because of their chorus or melody or whatever… when they sing “run run run” it literally is enough for me, it takes me to heaven and back ^^Anyways, That song really stood out to me. Just saying, I love all of their songs but to mention the above two are my favourites, but along with it are boy with luv, save me, Mic Drop, Fake Love, etc Fake Love is the reason why I started loving their songs, I saw their interviews first then their song for the first time which was Fake Love. I didn’t like Idol much then and can’t say if I do right now maybe because of how it was filmed… it seemed too much back then cause in American mv I had watched before they don’t include bright yellow pink bgs with animals in the back LOL so the hell was I surprised upon seeing Idol and that's also why I loved Fake Love.. it seemed the background connected with the song even though I didn’t understand Korean. So chances were IDOL’s bg and everything and all was perfect had I watched it with subtitles ^^ but still it doesn’t toll on me much and I was surprised to see it had the most views with 1 B . Anyways ^^ I hope this answer was what you needed to hear. Thanks for reading~

Well thats a hard one because all of their songs touch your heart in some way or another. Anyways, I have 3 for totally different reasons and I know you asked for 1, but what can I say, its BTS? I love Spring Day, it just brings back the nostalgia where I thought I was stepping into the fanbase just to bop to one of their songs and thats it. However, that did not happen, I have read, watched and listened to literally everything about them because they are great people and an amazing band. Spring Day's melody and beat right at the start just gets you a little emotional i guess, it was around the time, they were a small company and didn't have much fame going on and now looking back on this piece of music, you realise how far they've reached with records and awards. Also, I love Dionysus because it is such a bop, the rap line just pulled it off and just brought the bar up so high and the vocal line blended their vocals so well with the rapline and like the song was aggressively beautiful, and the performance was just AMAZING and I had to watch it again and again to get all my vitamins and minerals. Lastly, their recent song, “Your eyes Tell” was just so serene and let me just say Jimin and Jungkook killed the high notes putting a prepubescent girl to shame. The lyrics were just beautiful, also knowing the fact our Maknae had wrote and composed the song just felt really fulfilling and a proud moment for him as he did a great job.

Save Me is definitely my favorite song from the entire group and MV for it was visually appropriate and beautiful. The choreography fit well, and lots of props to the camera-man for that one shot. Skool Luv Affair is my favorite song from a subunit, which was the entire rap line in this case. I love how we got to hear all three of their rapping styles in clear succession and RM’s (my bias) part in it was an absolute bop. Seesaw by Suga is my favorite solo song from one of the members. There’s something about a member of the rapline singing so beautifully that pulls me in every time. But to be honest, any time Yoongi does anything, I have breath stoles. That’s why he’s my bias wrecker.

My favorite BTS song would have to be either Young Forever or Save Me. The Most Beautiful Moment In Life: Young Forever is my favorite album, and I have always loved Young Forever because the meaning is beautiful. They talk about how no matter what struggles they go through, they will endure it because they want to achieve their dream and stay young forever. Hoseok’s part is my favorite in this song. He explains how selfish it may be to want the audience forever, but he wants it anyway and he will continue to sing for us because he wants to stay young forever. I think this song is absolutely beautiful. Save Me is also right up there with Young Forever because it is probably one of the most romantic songs I’ve ever heard. They found the ones they love, ARMY, and they are so grateful for us. They explain how we’re the source of their happiness when Hoseok says “please raise your voice so I can smile/laugh again.” How is that not beautiful??!! Everything about this song is beautiful. They are asking us to save them, and then at the end, Namjoon is thanking us for all we’ve done. I love all of the lyrics in this song, but Namjoon’s might have to be my favorite in this song. He thanks us for giving him strength and how we helped him so much he threw away his sadness ending with “thank you, for being ‘us’.” Plus him harmonizing with Jungkook is so beautiful it needs to happen more often. So yeah these two are my favorites. I don’t know if I can choose between the two because whenever I feel like Save Me might take first place, Young Forever just comes in and reminds me how beautiful it is. Feel free to comment what your favorite song is, I would really like to know because BTS has so many great songs I didn’t think I could ever narrow down the list to these two :) I purple you all <3 Stay safe and healthy!

This is a difficult question to answer! Only 10! I will give myself some parameters to make it easier. No solo songs. I will be basing this mostly on the audio and lyrics, not the visuals/live stages/MVs. At least I will try. There are songs that I love but if I take out of consideration the live stages or MVs I end up putting others ahead. For instance, I love Airplane pt2, however, if I remove the live stages and Japanese MV then I have to give other songs a higher spot. Same with Not Today and Go Go. I want to explain why these are my favorites but please understand I have no musical knowledge beyond just liking what I like. I’m going to sound dumb. It’s a mess. In no particular order: Save Me: That high instrument sound in the beginning then Jimin’s angel voice. The amazing colors/lighting from the MV are in my mind when just listening. The lyrics seem sad but the song has a strange energy I can’t explain. Honestly this is one of their best songs, to me, that perfectly showcases BTS as a whole.Spring Day. Our Queen. Start to finish perfection. I love this song possibly the most but with the MV it’s definitely my favorite. The song is melancholy and yet hopeful. Soft pastel Jimin. The MV makes me sob and miss my mom. The piano at the start. Bogo shipda. RM (or Jhope) singing, transition to rap. Ugh, so good. Jhope with his sub vocals (if that is the proper term), JK harmonizing with RM and Hobi, Tae’s vocals in this song are some of his best, the Suga/Jimin part and then into Suga’s rap. Jin is perfect. The only thing that keeps this song from being absolutely the most perfect creation is Hoseok not having a bigger part. At the same time his part is huge with the sub vocals. I think he makes the song in a way?Just One Day. Exhibit 1: Suga’s whole verse.Exhibit 1a: That part where his voice goes lower. 1b: Yoongi-ah Exhibit 2: J-hope’s verse. I love the entire song but those parts are my favorites. This is one I sing along to. Badly sing along to but that’s okay.Blood Sweat & Tears: I love the energy of this song. Sensual. Our boys are all grown up! I’m not sure what else to say about this masterpiece. Money money money.Intro: Nevermind: Suga, lyrics, music/beat, Suga, lyrics,RM, Suga, Jhope, lyrics, Suga. I can’t even with this song. It gives me feels. Ya’ll Suga is my bias. This song is one of the many reasons. End of story.Dionysus: My young queen. Excuse me Jin and Jhope who gave you the right to be so perfect. I adore how different this song is. I stan BTS for their desire to explore their art.Mic Drop. Jhope, hello. This song is such a jam. Love the energy, the message. Suga. All of them. Probably my most quoted song. “Did you see my bag. Did you see my bag”134340. Pluto. I just call it Pluto, okay. Don’t come at me with numbers even when they have meaning. Well this song blew me away. The lyrics. Why you do this to me? Suga’s rap is top notch. I don’t mean to ignore the other members! Suga Bias.Pied Piper. Those lyrics. The vocals. Let’s stop there.Boy with Luv. Sigh. I love the sound and energy of this song. The lyrics though really get me. Poem for the Small Things. That right there is what makes love so special, right? It’s those little things, how’s your day, teach me about you, mannerisms. I know the song is about more than that and I love it all. Halsey adds and blends in perfectly. And, yes, Suga’s rap, shocking us with the low start!

In the hard rock version the guitar just sings. I don't know anymore Smile for me, tell me how our love still has a chance Look at me, have we really given up Where you at? Lover you said that you'd understand You won't take my hand, you're saying I'm not the guy that you used to love But how can you tell me that when you were the one who ripped me apart? What do you mean That our love Was never real? Is any love real ? I wonder Or is it all just fake love (Woo) I don't know, I don't know, I don't know why (Woo) Who's the face, looking back, From the mirror sky (Woo) I just know, I just know, I just know why 'Cause it's all fake love, fake love, fake love love you so bad, love you so bad A perfect illusion created for you I love you so mad, love you so mad A porcelain doll in the image you drew Love you so bad, love you so bad A fantasy image created for you Love you so mad, love you so mad A beautiful doll, Tossed away when you're through I'm so sick of this Fake love, fake love, fake love I'm so sorry but it's Fake love, fake love, fake love For you. I could be brave, And hide my fear until tomorrow For you, I numb my heart, Pretend to be the hope inside your sorrow Wish my devotion to you, Was not forsaken You know deep inside me There’s so much self hatred You trusted in a hopeless cause You’re staring at a bloom That has faded. response.answer_text: My favorite deep, meaningful BTS song is Sea. “Where there is hope, there is always hardship” is the line that is repeated throughout the song. Sounds simple? Yes. But to BTS? Nope. This song, along with the way it was produced, really brings out the way BTS saw their hardships coming during debut, and overall adjusting to fame. Hoseok even says, “I know I’ll overcome.” This inspires me, knowing that BTS has grown into the group they are today, but it didn’t come easy. They had to pass through those roughs seas and deserts, but sometimes everything is a mirage, and yet they still stay the humble people they are.

Whalien 52 This past Freshman year I had, I was deathly lonely. So much I started losing memory, and having breakdowns. It was a terrible time for me because I was in a place I couldn’t get out of. The song didn’t take me out of that place, but it always comforted me while I cried. There was always nothing on muni mind but how much ignorance hurt to feel like nobody cared about me. So listening and reading the lyrics helped me realize how many other felt that same way. That no matter how much it hurt, others felt that way too; that we’d all get through it even though we were singing different songs that seemingly couldn’t be heard.

I’ll do Group ones, so, whole group, rap line, vocal line, and then Solos. Whole group: I would have to say either, We Are Bulletproof: The Eternal or Fire. Those two are my favourites. Vocal Line: I would say House of cards. The Meaning of the lyrics is beautiful, the way it is composed and sung is like a blessing to the ears. Rap Line: Ugh, the whole song is just… AND HOBI’S VERSE. Incredible. Solos: RM: I would say either Change or Persona Jin: Epiphany. Do I need an explanation? Suga: Honestly all of his songs so I’m gonna say two… From D-2 it’s People. I just love this song in all honesty. Older is The Last. It brings me to tears when I listen. Not many songs can do that. J-Hope: Mama I just love it. Jimin: I would say… Filter. I struggle with sleeping and for some reason, this song always helps me sleep. V: Winter Bear. It’s the only song, apart from The Last that can make me cry real tears. Jungkook: I don’t actually know. I have to choose between Still With You and Euphoria. Thanks for reading! Peace ✌💜

Disclaimer: If I don’t say a song on this list and it happens to be your favorite, that’s cool! That doesn’t mean I hate it; I like basically all of BTS’ songs, but I just like some more than others. Autumn Leaves, Sea, The Truth Untold, Lost, House of Cards, Rain. These are some of my absolute FAVORITE songs by BTS. They’re just so sensational, and the melody just goes so well with the lyrics. They’re very well produced and the members voices shine very brightly. From their earlier albums, I also liked: Coffee, If I Ruled the World, Converse High, Spine Breaker, Attack on Bangtan, 2nd Grade. These songs are a little more hip-hop ish and more upbeat, and in the right mood, these songs would be my go-to jam. From their more recent albums, I liked: Dimple, Pied Piper, Paradise, Love Maze, Tear, Her, Jaimais Vu. These songs are a mix of chill and love yourself-style. Definitely all bops. I’m not actually one to have a title track as a favorite of an album, but my favorite of all the title tracks would HAVE to go to: Blood, Sweat, and Tears Cuz Jimin needs to calm down.

response.answer_text: Personally, my favorite BTS song is Answer: Love Myself. This song had literally saved my life, I was suicidal from the age of eight and I found K-Pop in the summer of 2019 when I was only 12. It depends on person to person. For me it’s Spring Day. The slightly odd but endearing backgrohnd sohnd, the second part of the chorus, the lyrics, the vocals, the rap, everything. I have the music video version downloaded so I get to listen to the train, waves and the ououoh~ part at the end. It’s a mssmerising song that gives me chills every time I listen to it and it actually makes you feel as if you’re listening to that period of time between winter and spring, if that period were a song. It also holds a personal meaning to me, which makes it the best BTS song in my opinion. My best friend and I live very far away from each other so once we were texting about how much we miss each other and then we both started crying. We then realised we were both listening to Spring Day. When I had family troubles, Spring Day told me “after winter passes, spring will come/ the morning will come again/ no darkness, no season can last forever”.

In terms of showcasing the vocal ability of the members and for soulful and emotional singing, Spring Day and The Truth Untold are the best in this aspect so they are also among my favourites. Even though it could be better, I have a soft spot for Black Swan. The instrumentals are really quite nice(the fact that there are real instruments in a k-pop song for a change, a reason why I stan IU because she often has different instruments in her songs) and the Music Video is definitely among the best in BTS discography. For Rap songs, Dope has the most driving and exciting beats and well executed raps that climaxes really nicely, so it’s another one of my favourites. Finally, Save Me rounds up my favourite BTS songs. It’s universal message and lyrics really speak to you.

response.answer_text: Favorite BTS song?! How am I supposed to pick?! There are so many. I Stan BTS hard. I could say I love them with all of my heart (I’m not a Sasaeng) I can narrow it down to my top 3–5. The truth untold- I have always loved this song. It’s so touching.Favorite part- You know that I can’tShow you meGive you meI can’t show you a ruined part of myselfOnce again I put a mask on and go to see youBut I still want you But I knowI can't do that foreverI have to hideBecause I'm a monster I am afraidI am shatteredI’m so afraidThat you will leave me again in the endOnce again I put on a mask and go to see you- I love this part because I can relate. I used to love someone that I could never have. He didn’t know I existed. He was always focused on someone or something else. I stood from afar and never got the courage to talk to him.
